trans-unit.source: Activity: Loops demos
trans-unit.target: アクティビティ: ループ デモ

trans-unit.source: Microsoft MakeCode has three different loop blocks:
trans-unit.target: マイクロソフト MakeCode には3 つの異なるループ ブロックがあります。

trans-unit.source: 'Repeat' block
trans-unit.target: 「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロック

trans-unit.source: 'While' block
trans-unit.target: 「真意条件を満たすなら繰り返す（While）」ブロック

trans-unit.source: 'For' block
trans-unit.target: 「変数の数だけ繰り返す（For）」ブロック

trans-unit.source: To start, the students can code the same algorithm they created in the unplugged activity using a loop.
trans-unit.target: まずは、アンプラグドのアクティビティで作成したものと同じアルゴリズムをコードに書き換えることから始めましょう。

trans-unit.source: ‘Repeat’ block
trans-unit.target: 「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロック

trans-unit.source: Code a Sprite to walk a square. Have students click on the Loops category in the Toolbox, and look at the three choices available.
trans-unit.target: スプライトが正方形の枠に沿って歩くようなコードを書きます。 ツールボックスの「ループ（Loops）」カテゴリをクリックし、使用可能な 3 つブロックの選択肢を見るように指示します。

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/loops-category.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/loops-category.png

trans-unit.source: Loops category
trans-unit.target: Loops category

trans-unit.source: The very first one is the ‘repeat’ block! Have students drag the repeat block to the coding Workspace. They’ll notice that this block takes a parameter.
trans-unit.target: まず最初の 1 つは 「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロックです！生徒たちに「くりかえし」ブロックをコーディング ワークスペースにドラッグするように指示します。生徒たちは、このブロックが パラメーター を受け取ることに気づくでしょう。

trans-unit.source: A parameter is a type of variable used as input to a function or routine.
trans-unit.target: パラメーター とは、関数またはルーチンへの入力として使用する変数の一種です。

trans-unit.source: In this case, the parameter tells the repeat block how many times we want the code within the block to repeat.
trans-unit.target: この場合、パラメーターは「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロックに対して、ブロック内のコードを何回繰り返すかを指定します。

trans-unit.source: For now, we’ll leave the parameter at 4.
trans-unit.target: 今は、パラメーターは4 のままにしておきましょう。

trans-unit.source: To create a sprite that will walk a square:
trans-unit.target: 正方形の周りを移動する スプライト を作成する：

trans-unit.source: Click on the Advanced category in the Toolbox. This will open up a more advanced menu of blocks.
trans-unit.target: ツールボックスの 「高度なブロック（Advanced）」カテゴリをクリックします。 より高度なブロックのメニューが開きます。

trans-unit.source: Click on Game category, and drag a ‘create sprite’ block to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: 「ゲーム（Game）」のカテゴリをクリックして、「スプライトを作成（create sprite）」ブロックをコーディング ワークスペースにドラッグします。

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/game-category.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/game-category.png

trans-unit.source: Game category
trans-unit.target: Game category

trans-unit.source: We’ll need two more blocks from the Game menu. Referring to their ‘Walk a Square’ pseudocode, see if the students can find the blocks they need for moving their sprite and turning their sprite.
trans-unit.target: 「ゲーム（Game）」メニューからさらに 2 つのブロックが必要です。「正方形の周りを移動する」の擬似コードを参照しながら、生徒がスプライトの移動と回転のために必要なブロックを見つけ出せるかどうか聞いてみましょう。

trans-unit.source: Drag out a ‘move by’ block and a ‘turn right by’ block.
trans-unit.target: 「スプライトを１ドット進める（move by）」ブロックと、「スプライトを方向転換右に45度（turn right by）」ブロックをドラッグします。

trans-unit.source: They now have these blocks in their coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: これで、3つのブロックがコーディング ワークスペースにある状態になりました。

trans-unit.source: For this project, they can delete the default ‘forever’ block.
trans-unit.target: このプロジェクトでは、初期設定の「ずっと（forever）」ブロックは削除してもよいです。

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/game-sprite.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/game-sprite.png

trans-unit.source: Game sprite blocks
trans-unit.target: Game sprite blocks

trans-unit.source: Time to fix those default parameter values!
trans-unit.target: パラメーターの初期設定を変更しましょう！

trans-unit.source: We want our sprite to start in the top left corner of the micro:bit screen, so change the parameters for both x and y to zero.
trans-unit.target: スプライトが micro:bit のLED画面の左上隅からスタートするように、x と y パラメーターの値を両方とも０に変更します。

trans-unit.source: To make the sprite move from one side of the screen to the other (as though walking around a chair), change the move by parameter to 4.
trans-unit.target: スプライトを（イスの周りを歩くような感じで）スクリーンの端から端に移動させるために、move by パラメーターを4に変更します。

trans-unit.source: To make the sprite turn to walk a square, change the ‘turn right by’ degrees to 90. For now, it's OK to leave the sprite turning right instead of left as we did in our pseudocode.
trans-unit.target: スプライトが正方形にそって曲がるようにするために、‘turn right by’ の角度を 90に変更します。疑似コードではスプライトは左に曲がりましたが、今は右に曲がる状態のままででOKです。

trans-unit.source: Your blocks now look like this:
trans-unit.target: ブロックはこのようになっているはずです。

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/sprite-params.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/iteration/sprite-params.png

trans-unit.source: Game sprite blocks params
trans-unit.target: Game sprite blocks params

trans-unit.source: Notice that the blocks are all grayed out. That’s because we have not yet attached them to any event handlers.
trans-unit.target: ブロックが灰色表示になっていることに気づいたでしょうか。これはブロックをまだイベントハンドラーに組み込んでいないからです。

trans-unit.source: On start, we want the sprite to appear. To make this happen, go to the Variables menu and drag a ‘set item to’ block to the coding window.
trans-unit.target: プログラム開始時にスプライトが現れるようしましょう。そのためには、「変数（Variables）」メニューから「変数 item を ～ にする（set item to）」を選んでコーディング ワークスペースにドラッグします。

trans-unit.source: Place the ‘set item block’ into the ‘on start’ block.
trans-unit.target: 「変数 item を ～ にする（set item to）」を「最初だけ（on start）」ブロックに組み入れます。

trans-unit.source: Attach the ‘create sprite’ block to the ‘set item’ block
trans-unit.target: 「スプライトを作成（create sprite）」ブロックを「変数 item を ～ にする（set item to）」ブロックに組み込みます。

trans-unit.source: let item: game.LedSprite = null item = game.createSprite(0, 0)
trans-unit.target: let item: game.LedSprite = null item = game.createSprite(0, 0)

trans-unit.source: You should now see the sprite appear in the top left of the micro:bit simulator.
trans-unit.target: これで micro:bit シミュレーターのLED画面左上にスプライトが現れるようになりました。

trans-unit.source: To add more control for when our sprite moves, drag a ‘on button A pressed’ block from the Input menu.
trans-unit.target: To add more control for when our sprite moves, drag a 「ボタンAが押されたとき（on button A pressed）」 block from the 入力(Input)メニュー.

trans-unit.source: Place the ‘repeat’ block into the ‘on button A pressed’ block
trans-unit.target: 「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロックを「ボタンAが押されたとき（on button A pressed）」ブロックに組み込みます。

trans-unit.source: Place the ‘move by’ block into the ‘repeat’ block
trans-unit.target: 「スプライトを１ドット進める（move by）」ブロックを「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロックに組み込みます。

trans-unit.source: Place the ‘turn right by’ block into the ‘repeat’ block just under the ‘move by’ block.
trans-unit.target: 「スプライトを方向転換右に45度（turn right by）」を、「くりかえし（Repeat）」ブロック内にある「スプライトを１ドット進める（move by）」ブロックのすぐしたに組み込みます。

trans-unit.source: Go ahead and run the program. Make the sprite move by pressing button A.
trans-unit.target: プログラムを実行します。Aボタンを押してスプライトを移動させてみましょう。

trans-unit.source: What happened? Did you see the sprite move? No?
trans-unit.target: どうなりましたか？スプライトはきちんと動きましたか？ダメでしたか？

trans-unit.source: So, the code is running and the sprite is moving!
trans-unit.target: So, the code is running and the sprite is moving!

trans-unit.source: Sometimes we forget just how fast computers are.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes we forget just how fast computers are.

trans-unit.target: So that we can see the sprite move even in ‘regular’ mode, lets add a pause to our program right after each time the sprite moves.

trans-unit.source: If there is time, let the students experiment with changing the parameters to see how these changes affect their program.

trans-unit.source: We just used the first of the 3 different types of Loop blocks available to us. What about the other 2 loop blocks, ‘while’ and ‘for’?
trans-unit.target: We just used the first of the 3 different types of ループ ブロック available to us. What about the other 2 ループ ブロック, 「もし真ならくりかえし（while）」 and ‘for’?

trans-unit.source: ‘For’ block: traveling light
trans-unit.target: ‘For’ block: traveling light

trans-unit.source: The ‘for’ block is useful when you have a variable in your loop that you want to change by a fixed amount within a specific range each time through a loop.
trans-unit.target: The ‘for’ block is useful when you have 変数 in your loop that you want to change by a fixed amount within a specific range each time through a loop.

trans-unit.source: What does this mean?
trans-unit.target: What does this mean?

trans-unit.source: Let’s look at an example.
trans-unit.target: Let’s look at ひとつの例.

trans-unit.source: Let’s make an led light move across the entire display from left to right, top row to bottom row.
trans-unit.target: Let’s make an led light move across the entire display from left to right, top row to bottom row.

trans-unit.source: Our pseudocode for the first row might look like this:
trans-unit.target: 疑似コード for the first row might look like this:

trans-unit.source: Turn led x:0, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:0, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:1, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:1, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:2, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:2, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:3, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:3, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:4, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:4, y:0 off
trans-unit.target: Turn led x:0, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:0, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:1, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:1, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:2, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:2, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:3, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:3, y:0 off Pause Turn led x:4, y:0 on Pause Turn led x:4, y:0 off

trans-unit.source: That’s a lot of code, most of it repeated. Perfect for a loop.
trans-unit.target: That’s a lot of code, most of it repeated. Perfect for a loop.

trans-unit.source: What is the only variable that is changing in this pseudocode? The value of the x coordinate.
trans-unit.target: What is the only variable that is changing in this pseudocode? The value of the x coordinate.

trans-unit.source: How much is the value of the x coordinate changing each time? The value of the x coordinate is changing by 1 each time.
trans-unit.target: How much is the value of the x coordinate changing each time? The value of the x coordinate is changing by 1 each time.

trans-unit.source: What is the range of values for the x coordinate? The range of values for the x coordinate is 0 through 4.
trans-unit.target: What is the range of values for the x coordinate? The range of values for the x coordinate is 0 through 4.

trans-unit.source: Now let’s code!
trans-unit.target: Now let’s code!

trans-unit.source: From the Loops Toolbox drawer, drag a ‘for’ block to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the ループ(Loops)メニュー, drag a ‘for’ block to コーディング ワークスペース.

trans-unit.source: Since we’ll be changing the value of the x coordinate, make a new variable, named xindex.
trans-unit.target: Since we’ll be changing the value of the x coordinate, make a new variable, named xindex.

trans-unit.source: We’ll plot and unplot the leds to turn them on and off. From the Led Toolbox drawer, drag a 'plot' block and an 'unplot' block to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: We’ll plot and unplot the leds to turn them on and off. From the LEDメニュー, drag a 'plot' block and an 'unplot' block to コーディング ワークスペース.

trans-unit.source: From the Basic Toolbox drawer, drag two ‘pause’ blocks to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the 基本（Basic）メニュー, drag two 「一時停止（pause）」 blocks to コーディング ワークスペース.

trans-unit.source: Place the following blocks into the ‘for’ block: the ‘plot’ block, a ‘pause’ block, the ‘unplot’ block, the second 'pause' block.
trans-unit.target: Place the following blocks into the ‘for’ block: the ‘plot’ block, a 「一時停止（pause）」 block, the ‘unplot’ block, the second 「一時停止（pause）」 block.

trans-unit.source: Place the ‘for’ block inside a forever block.
trans-unit.target: Place the ‘for’ block inside a forever block.

trans-unit.source: Let’s look at the parameters.
trans-unit.target: Let’s look at the parameters.

trans-unit.source: Change the ‘index’ in the ‘for’ block to the ‘xindex’ variable we made.
trans-unit.target: Change the ‘index’ in the ‘for’ block to the ‘xindex’ variable we made.

trans-unit.source: Change the value of the x coordinates in the plot and unplot blocks to this same variable.
trans-unit.target: Change the value of the x coordinates in the plot and unplot blocks to this same variable.

trans-unit.source: We can use the default values for the rest of the parameters.
trans-unit.target: We can use the default values for the rest of the parameters.

trans-unit.source: You should now see a light moving from left to right along the top row of the micro:bit simulator.
trans-unit.target: You should now see a light moving from left to right along the top row of micro:bit シミュレーター.

trans-unit.source: To make our pattern continue through all the leds, we can change the value of the y coordinate as well.
trans-unit.target: To make our pattern continue through all the leds, we can change the value of the y coordinate as well.

trans-unit.source: To do this efficiently, using the fewest lines of code, we can even put a loop inside a loop. Loops inside other loops are known as nested loops.
trans-unit.target: To do this efficiently, using the fewest lines of code, we can even put a loop inside a loop. Loops inside other loops are known as nested loops.

trans-unit.source: So that we can change the value of the y coordinate, make a new variable, named yindex.
trans-unit.target: So that we can change the value of the y coordinate, make a new variable, named yindex.

trans-unit.source: Drag out another ‘for’ block from the Loops Toolbox drawer.
trans-unit.target: Drag out another ‘for’ block from the ループ(Loops)メニュー.

trans-unit.source: Place this new ‘for’ block around our original ‘for’ block, all within the forever block.
trans-unit.target: Place this new ‘for’ block around our original ‘for’ block, all within the forever block.

trans-unit.source: Change the ‘index’ in the outer ‘for’ block to the ‘yindex’ variable we made.
trans-unit.target: Change the ‘index’ in the outer ‘for’ block to the ‘yindex’ variable we made.

trans-unit.source: Change the value of the y coordinates in the plot and unplot blocks to this same variable.
trans-unit.target: Change the value of the y coordinates in the plot and unplot blocks to this same variable.

trans-unit.source: There! With only a half dozen or so lines of code, we have made our light travel through all the coordinates on the micro:bit screen.
trans-unit.target: There! With only a half dozen or so lines of code, we have made our light travel through all the coordinates on the micro:bit screen.

trans-unit.source: Check: Make sure the students can read this code.
trans-unit.target: Check: Make sure 生徒たち can read this code.

trans-unit.source: Here is what is happening to the values of the x & y coordinates as the program steps through each line and loop inside the forever block:
trans-unit.target: Here is what is happening to the values of the x & y coordinates as the program steps through each line and loop inside the forever block:

trans-unit.source: In the outer of the two for loops, the value of the y-coordinate is set to 0.
trans-unit.target: In the outer of the two for loops, the value of the y-coordinate is set to 0.

trans-unit.source: The nested inner loop then sets the value of the x-coordinate to zero.
trans-unit.target: The nested 内側ループ then sets the value of the x-coordinate to zero.

trans-unit.source: The corresponding led (x:0, y:0) is plotted and then unplotted.
trans-unit.target: The corresponding led (x:0, y:0) is plotted and then unplotted.

trans-unit.source: Then the value of the x-coordinate is increased by 1 and step #3 runs again with the coordinates now (x:1, y:0).
trans-unit.target: Then the value of the x-coordinate is increased by 1 and step #3 runs again with the coordinates now (x:1, y:0).

trans-unit.source: Then the value of the x-coordinate is increased by 1 again and step #3 runs again with the coordinates now (x:2, y:0).
trans-unit.target: Then the value of the x-coordinate is increased by 1 again and step #3 runs again with the coordinates now (x:2, y:0).

trans-unit.source: The inner loop keeps running like this until it has completed its loop with the value of the x coordinate now 4.
trans-unit.target: 内側ループ keeps running like this until it has completed its loop with the value of the x coordinate now 4.

trans-unit.source: With the inner loop complete, the program now runs the second iteration of the outer loop, increasing the value of the y-coordinate by 1, then back to the inner loop which runs 4 more times stepping through values for x from 0 through 4.
trans-unit.target: With 内側ループ complete, the program now runs the second iteration of the outer loop, increasing the value of the y-coordinate by 1, then back to 内側ループ which runs 4 more times stepping through values for x from 0 through 4.

trans-unit.source: Have the students use the Slo-Mo mode to watch the program step through the loops.
trans-unit.target: Have 生徒たち use the Slo-Mo mode to watch the program step through the loops.

trans-unit.source: By the end of the program run, how many times has the inner loop executed? 25
trans-unit.target: By the end of the program run, how many times has 内側ループ executed? 25

trans-unit.source: Other than knowing that there are 25 LEDs and each is lit up once, how can you figure this out?
trans-unit.target: Other than knowing that there are 25 LEDs and each is lit up once, how can you figure this out?

trans-unit.source: ><em>The outer loop loops 5 times altogether, once for every value of the y coordinate from 0 through 4.
trans-unit.target: ><em>The outer loop loops 5 times altogether, once for every value of the y coordinate from 0 through 4.

trans-unit.source: Each time the outer loop runs, the inner loop runs 5 times, once for every value of the x coordinate from 0 through 4. 5 runs of the outer loop x 5 runs of the inner loop = 25 times the inner loop executes.
trans-unit.target: Each time the outer loop runs, 内側ループ runs 5 times, once for every value of the x coordinate from 0 through 4. 5 runs of the outer loop x 5 runs of 内側ループ = 25 times 内側ループ executes.

trans-unit.source: ‘While’ block: micro:bit alarm!
trans-unit.target: 「もし真ならくりかえし（while）」 block: micro:bit alarm!

trans-unit.source: The while block is useful when you want your program to loop until a certain event happens or a different condition is met.
trans-unit.target: The while block is useful when you want your program to loop until a certain イベント happens or a different condition is met.

trans-unit.source: For example, maybe you want an alarm to sound if someone shakes your micro:bit! In order to turn the alarm off, you press the button A. Until you press the button, the alarm should continue to sound!
trans-unit.target: 例えば、 maybe you want an alarm to sound if someone shakes your micro:bit! In order to turn the alarm off, you press the Aボタン. Until you press the button, the alarm should continue to sound!

trans-unit.source: You can use a 'while' block with a nested ‘repeat’ block like this:
trans-unit.target: You can use a 「もし真ならくりかえし（while）」 block with a nested 「くりかえし（repeat）」 block like this:

trans-unit.source: Can you read what this code does?
trans-unit.target: Can you read what this code does?

trans-unit.source: Can you write out pseudocode that describes what this code does?
trans-unit.target: Can you write out pseudocode that describes what this code does?

trans-unit.source: Example Pseudocode:
trans-unit.target: Example Pseudocode:

trans-unit.source: When someone shakes the micro:bit, while button A is not pressed, play the two tone alarm twice. Keep playing the alarm tones until the user presses the A button.
trans-unit.target: When someone shakes the micro:bit, while Aボタン is not pressed, play the two tone alarm twice. Keep playing the alarm tones until ユーザー presses Aボタン.

trans-unit.source: To use sound with your micro:bit, you will need to connect it to some speakers or headphones. See how to do this here: Hack you headphones.
